titleStmt.title: E. N. Owen et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8872

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: We the undersigned Citizens of Caldwell County would respectfully ask that you interpose and Remit so much of the fine of Sixty Dollars, $60, Recovered against Fay Young a Citizen of Caldwell County at the present June Term of the Caldwell Circuit Court ^(as you in the exercise of your authority may have a right to remit)^. The Recovy was had by a confession of Judgment ^charged with the offense of Keeping a Tipling House.^ That we believe F Young would not violate the law if properly advised of the requirements of the same,

Very Respectfully &c
E N Owen
T L. McNary
R. H. J. Daridge
H M Witherspoon
J. P. Gracey
J, R, Farless
E P Watkins
A. Reynolds
E. Baker
J. N. Turner
N B, Ratliff
J. C. Barnes
A. C,, Wrays

Mr. Young acknowledged his guilt in Open Court and all I can say for him is that he is a verry poor man and the offence was committed while the Rebel Army occupied and held possession of South Kentucky
Citizens of Caldwell County Pettn remission of fine agst Fay Young
Fine remitted except sum of ten dollars ($10./ & costs

J F Robinson
$60 } Tipling
Issd June 22. 1863
